circuit_name: Diode Static Operating Point Analysis Circuit (Load Line Graphical Analysis Circuit)
domain: Fundamentals of Analog Electronics / Semiconductor Diodes and Basic Circuits

components.name: DC Voltage Source
components.function: Provides energy for the entire circuit, setting the total voltage reference for operation.

components.name: Crystal Diode
components.function: Core nonlinear component. The relationship between its current and terminal voltage is described by the nonlinear equation I = f(V).

components.name: Linear Resistor
components.function: Current-limiting and load resistor. Together with VDD, it forms the external linear circuit, determining the load line.

components.name: Switch
components.function: Controls the circuit's on/off state or changes input conditions for different analysis scenarios.

circuit_function.summary: Determines the actual operating voltage (V) and current (I) of a nonlinear component (diode) within a specific linear circuit environment, i.e., solves for its static operating point (Q-point).
circuit_function.detailed: The circuit is divided into a nonlinear part (diode D) and a linear part (power supply VDD and resistor R). By simultaneously solving the load line equation V = VDD - I*R and the diode's volt-ampere characteristic curve I = f(V), the operating point is obtained graphically.

characteristics.analysis_method: Load Line Method / Graphical Analysis Method
advantages: Shows how the operating point shifts with parameter changes
disadvantages: Not suitable for complex circuit calculations

variants: Replace diode with other nonlinear components (e.g., Zener diode, LED)

precautions.safety: Low-voltage, low-current teaching model with no special safety hazards.
precautions.component_selection: Ensure resistor R is large enough to limit diode current within the safe operating range.
precautions.debugging_tips: Understand that the load line slope is determined by R (-1/R) and its intercept by VDD.
